lines.text: My sister was right about one thing. When we are forgotten, we cease to exist.
You've tricked me, Merlin.
Come, come Uther. I am a wizard, that's my business.
I like the old ways. The old ways gave me Mordred. And they made me beautiful.
But beauty is only an illusion.
Beauty is always only an illusion.
You've grown older.

[Chuckles]
. You too.
Does it even matter?
No. Not anymore.
Why didn't you kill him, Auntie Mab?
Because that's what he wanted me to do.
You killed her.
No, I didn't. I only let her die.
Don't die!
Die? That is the last thing I shall do.
[dies]
No...
[roars]
It's human to make mistakes Merlin, and part of you is human, the best part.
Magic has no power over the human heart.
Faith is Supreme, of course. But love is even better.
Patience isn't one of my virtues
You have so few of those, I wouldn't worry about that one.
I'm sorry father, but I'm going to destroy you. And this time, your pet wizard won't save you.
With evil all around me, I can do nothing but evil to survive.
Oh... that's too easy.
I made a mistake that night with Morgan. But I can't believe that I'll be condemned for all eternity for one mistake.
No, not by me. I'll never condemn you Arthur.
Good-bye Frick. I'll miss you. No, I won't.
Lancelot always saved everything to the last moment. And then my memory of Lancelot is that he never got anything right.
I have a life to live and a chance to live it.
It's time to end it all.
Well... we agree on that at least. You know father, if you'd lived, I don't think we'd have been very happy as a family.

I had won. I was trying to smile but it was the smile of desolution. Inside, I felt only the pity and the terror and the waste of it all. Everyone I had ever loved, and who ever loved me - all gone... all gone down...
Am I beautiful, my love?
Beyond words. Am I?
Oh yes. Beyond words.
They say that when you're unhappy, time crawls by. When you're happy, however... my childhood must have been very happy.
Oh, they hurt... memories. Memories of love, they hurt. Our world was tearing tiself to pieces and I didn't care. Those were truly the happiest days of my life.
A reputation is like glass, once cracked it can never be replaced.
I was his tutor. I didn't teach him magic. I taught him ethics and morals. It is much more difficult, believe me.
Are you going to use some of your magic on me Merlin?
I'll kill you any way I can Vortigern, but I will kill you.

[Appearing to his childhood self]
And that's another thing, Young Merlin, don't start giving advice...
And you can tell Her Royal High and Mighty Queen Mab that magic or no magic, if she harms you in any way, I'll have her guts for my boot laces.
Die, dear Auntie Mab? That's the last thing I shall do.
It's easy to die knowing you'll die for your country.
Good king. Bad king. You judge too easily Merlin. You will learn.
I didn't send for you
That's why I'm here
Handsome is as handsome does. What does that mean? I never really understood the phrase.
I'm thinking of the future here Morgan.
Oh, you would think of the future, Merlin. Because the past is too painful.
Merlin, what should I do?
In the end, you must uphold the law.
Will you be able to handle Mordred?
It's just one more battle. And right is on our side.
I knew I would never see her again.
Thank you my old friend, for everything.
Oh, no need to thank me. I just love happy endings.
That is a mistake many of my enemies make. They think before they act. I act before I think.
You've been sliding down the ladder of success so quickly these last few years you must have got splinters in your backside.
Father, you've hurt me. Here, in my heart. Not usually one of my vulnerable spots.
[last lines]
There's no more. That's the end of magic...

[after Mab and Frick had just appeared out of the closed door]
We thought we would come in the traditional way, through the door.
Its traditional to open it first.
Mordred, never be rude! Being rude is weak.
How are you Frik?
Over-worked and under-paid, how terribly sweet of you to inquire.
It's a lovely story. And so are you.
Do you know what love is Merlin?
Yes Uther, sad to say, I know what love is.

Things fall apart, they say. Uther had betrayed me, killed Cornwall. But then, I'd betrayed Igraine by helping Uther seduce her. So the wheel of life turns - one betrayal leads to another and another. The innocent die. It haunted me for the rest of my life.
You'll always be beautiful to me.
To be closer to my God.
The closer you are to him, the farther you are from me.

[to Queen Mab]
You are so cold! If I would punch you in the heart I'd break my fist.
I'm glad to see you haven't lost all the skills I taught you...
I've lost none of them. And it was Frik who taught me!
Don't mention that ingrate! He left my employment... without a reference!
Let the whole world die, if I die...
You... you don't believe in anything.
I believe in me.
That's not enough to make us win.
I'll tell you.
Who the devil are you?
Eloquently put, "Who the devil?". Yes indeed. Who the devil?
Oh, I'm hurt, here, in my heart. Not usually my most vulnerable spot. I recognize you, Father.
She sleeps alone at last. One day she was laughing, smiling, the next, gone like a summer breeze in the midst of life, etc, etc, etc, and so on and so forth.
Guinevere how could you do it? Did you not think of me at all?
You left me alone for years, did you not think of me? What of my honor finding out my husband had a child by a woman called Morgan Le Fay?
Good one. Oh, come, Father, this is becoming distressingly personal.
But?...
Well, in his heart, he hates magic. He wants to go home.
Home. Home?
[whimpers]
HOME?
Out my lords.
OUT!
And close the door behind you!
That's what this is about, isn't it Mab? Uthur will bring Christianity to the people and you'll be forgotten.
[Mab sheds a tear]
Only one person shed a tear for Vortigern, and he threw it away.
I curse you all!
[beheaded by Vortigern's men]
